intro: Scleranthus marginellus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and disturbed areas. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces small white or yellowish flowers. Scleranthus marginellus is generally herbaceous and can be either annual or perennial depending on the region.
